page.title: 11ROYAL CHARTER MOELFRE 4
page.content: A diver showed us some artefacts from The Royal Charter. We saw some nickel silver plated cutlery with "L.& A. Navigation Co." stamped on them. We also saw a mould for making bullets still usable, a pair of pistols cocked ready for use, gunpowder horn,sewing set,silver candle holder, pair of spectacles and lenses, jam jars found with remains of jam.We saw gold items, rings, chains, snuff box, a nugget worth approx. Â£1,000, several sovereigns worth approx. Â£3,000 each. The divers would not say how much gold they had found, probably because it must be substantial. Journalists claim that gold bars have been found. The diver said that one gold bar is worth approx. Â£150,000. David Mathews & Haley Morris.
